title: NO REFUND FOR BEDBUGS
text: They dont issue full refunds when you get placed in an airbnb infested with bed bugs. Nor do they accommodate you to resolve the situation. Im going back to hotels. Useless help with this “company”!!!

title: reservation
text: I made a reservation a month before and the day I had to receive the house the host sent me a message that I had to cancel the reservation because the house had a problem and she didn't even help me get another one and I had to sleep in my car until find a hotel after taking a 5 hour flight and then I called Airbnb support and they told me they couldn't do anything and I couldn't even give the host a bad review.

title: Terrible Experience
text: My experience with Airbnb has been terrible. They prioritized a double booking to VRBO client and canceled mine. I asked for them to provide the documentation that they require the host to provide in the event of a cancellation (documentation per their host guidelines) and they wouldn’t provide it or the part in the policy that says they can’t relay that information to the customer. I was transferred to 5 different supervisors. On the last transfer they said are escalating and then closed the case on me.

title: Restricted my profile
text:
Airbnb restricted my profile this week. I cannot book the property(s) I would like to book. I was restricted from booking without being notified and after contacting customer service, I wasn’t given a clear reason for this restriction. 

I have nothing but GOOD reviews from the hosts, not one complaint. I contacted customer service 18 hours ago as of right now. I haven’t heard anything back from customer service. Very disappointing. Just booked my new next place on a different platform. I’m a digital nomad. I travel and work online. This is beyond inconvenient! 

Anyone looking to book accommodation overseas, do some research and you’ll notice plenty of competitors in this space with less or similar resources as Airbnb but much better customer service.

title: They will let hosts walk all over you
text: If you are a guest, be ready to be taken advantage of financially. Hosts have all the power to fine, charge, and add dumb rules. Their support left me on read 5 times and counting. They just decide they don’t want to respond and they have no QA, so I can send a review for the agent. They can do whatever they want. Good luck guests

title: Verification process is horrible
text: I tried multiple times to upload my Id to be verified to rent places and the app wouldn’t accept my identification. I was looking forward to using the app but looks like I won’t be renting from any places on air bnb.

title: Bad company, app is fool’s gold
text:
The idea that you could choose to stay in a stranger’s home instead of a hotel, with clear standards for their facilities and policies, relies on one thing: that customers who have a bad experience can share their stories with other potential customers, to help avoid bad actors.

Airbnb stops this from happening!

I reserved a whole home for a Hawaii trip and arrived to find the place unusable [sweltering hot with tiny, moldy air conditioners]. “Host” lives 5000mi away and stopped responding after 5:15p. We left.

Airbnb censored our review w/ zero profanity, nothing else problematic. No refund. 

Keep this is mind when you see all these properties available with 4.x scores. How many horror stories did Airbnb suppress?

title: Literal Scam in 2024
text: Airbutts customer service is complete trash. Expect to be ripped off and scammed out of your money using this app.

title: Not allowed to review the booking
text: If your booking is cancelled and you lost a lot of money because of this, you are not allowed to review on the booking. I don’t understand this policy. I lost thousands of dollars on the booking, at least give me the right to review the booking. I will never use Airbnb again because of this stupid policy!

title: ID verification is painful
text: I have uploaded my ID for verification multiple times and each time i am prompted with request expired message. This caused my booking to be cancelled on the day of my trip. My preferred home got booked by someone else and i am blocked from making any new reservations. This spoiled my trip plan and i am ending with up paying higher amount for a hotel.

title: Horrible app
text: Every single place on this app is wildly overpriced. Hosts expect you to deep clean their place before you leave. Pet friendly hosts complain of pet hair after you check out. A hotel is 100x cheaper and more convenient every single time.

title: Messages consistently fail to send.
text: It happens quite often and always when it’s a last-minute reservation and we are trying to sort out details. It’s an absolute pain. No matter if I am on Wi-Fi or using data, messages failed to send.

title: Disappointed.
text:
Airbnb decided the day before my booked trip to cancel the whole trip and my account. 
They said the reason was because they ran a background check but I have a clean record and have had this account for around 2 years and have booked things previous. I am EXTREMELY disappointed in the lack of customer service and how my account was wrongfully closed. Also there is no one available to even to too let alone customer service you have to send a request for someone to reach out in their own good time, no manager, no supervisor , they can’t give you any details, no one to actually work with when you do experience an issue. I am considering taking legal action and again cannot express how disappointed I am in having everything planned out and the DAY BEFORE I didn’t even get notice, they claimed to had sent an email but I did not receive one, I asked if they could resend it but oh! No one available to do that! The only reason I knew was because I was so excited to go and went to go show the pictures of the property to my friend and nothing would load and I had no account ?! All I know is that I’m contacting the lawyer.

title: Messaging NOT working
text: It is not possible to reply to a message received in the app. I called airbnb and reported it. Until it is fixed, message replies will only be possible through the website.

title: Life Changing/Fairytale Setting
text: The accommodations, the setting, the architecture, and the entire experience was that of a fairytale for this American. I cannot express enough the complete satisfaction with this location, accommodations, and host. Truly a life changing experience for us. The beauty of the area and the freshness of the air cannot be compared. Book this and journey as quickly as you can to experience the beauty that will blanket your soul.

title: Used to be good
text: Now with excessive cleaning fees and bad hosts who AirBnb doesn’t check, it’s a rip off and terrible place to rent a place. Better off at a hotel with staff.

title: Notifications Stopped Working
text: Please fix! After the most recent update I’m not receiving any notifications. I uninstalled & reinstalled app, checked notification settings and they’re all turned on.

title: Terrible customer service
text: No one at this company cares about their customers. I have had my account hacked and all they can do for me is tell me that someone will get back to me. I am so frustrated with the lack of concern for anyone’s personal privacy. WORST COMPANY EVER!!!!

title: Terrible experience
text:
If I could give zero starts I would, don’t know why they advertise homes for 10+ guests if they deny your booking because they suspect you’re using it for a party house. 
We are traveling to Milwaukee for a night to attend PBR on a Saturday. We are only staying one night that’s all we need and we are riding together so we decided to stay somewhere we could all be together. But I guess according to air BNB we are using the home for a party. After speaking to the home owner who was totally okay with our group staying we reached out to customer service to see if they would lift the restriction, they didn’t. Just a waste of time.

title: Terrible service
text: We are superhosts. We had a review rightly removed cause it was against airbnb policy. Now the review reappears every single week and we have to call every single week to get it removed AGAIN and AGAIN and absolutely nobody can do anything about it.

title: Bad
text: Worst customer service

title: HOST VS GUEST
text:
This Airbnb is a fake. If you write a negative review it might not be approved by Airbnb administrators. Also, if you write a negative review, the host will take reprisals by writing a bad review about you. The cleaning fee could be too expensive in some places. Recently I wrote a review about a Cofresí Condominiums Apartment in Rincon Puerto Rico. The host name is Alex. According to the description, the place is walking distance to the beach. But there is a broken stairs that doesn’t allows walking access to the beach. According to one neighbor that has been living there for years, the stairs was broken many years ago due to floodings. Therefore, the description is wrong and fraudulent. As of February 2024 that stairs is still broken. 

Because of my review, the host’s review was bad about me as a guest. 

Why Airbnb doesn’t investigate this place and remove them from Airbnb due to fraudulent promotion ???

title: Non stop notifications
text: Generally a fan but I’ve received 86 notifications in a span of 12 hours notifying me of the same confirmed booking. At this stage in the companies lifecycle, there should be better stability and performance, and the focus on being design first needs to change.

title: What happened?
text: I don’t like how you no longer can just search all of the houses. You only can choose an experience.

title: The worst customer service in the world!
text: If you have an issue with Airbnb, you write them a message and they keep answering you with the same words over and over. You tell the problem again and again, but there is no solution. At the end you get really exhausted and give up. This is how Airbnb works. They have automated messaging I guess. Whatever you say, they answer “I know how frustrating this is bla bla..” They are not trying to make you happy, they don’t care about you.

title: Service fees
text: The service and cleaning fees are getting out of hand

title: Early access
text: Why do you guys have a badge showing up on iOS for early access. We don’t want any badges. Unless we have something we need to action. Like with a guest message or review. You have got to get rid of that immediately.

title: BE AWARE
text: This company does not protect you from cancellations they take all your money if you have to cancel your booking for any type of emergency …. No matter what if you don’t show up they’ll take your money! Cheap has a price be careful!

title: never using airbnb again
text:
app works fine this is a review for airbnb’s garbage customer service and policies. 

a while back i stayed at a cabin that ended up being infested with roaches and had black mold on the walls. my friends and i drove 12 hours, spent $300 on groceries and other things, just to have to pack everything up and throw out most of the food bc of the roaches. of course the host didn’t take any accountability and airbnb refused a refund for the days that we stayed there. worst part?  the listing for that cabin is still up even after i sent them photos and videos of at least 20+ roaches crawling all over the countertops and inside the dishwasher. they basically told me that the listing has to be reported more times by other customers before they can take action??? this company does not have standards and do not care about their customers AT ALL. my friends and i will never use airbnb again and i have warned so many others to stay away from them.

title: The app is giving me issues
text:
It keeps giving me "the operation couldn't be completed" 
I don't know what's happening with it.

title: Joke of a company and app
text: Airbnb charges ridiculous fees on top of everything. They also are able to decide what places you can book or cannot book. Airbnb told me I couldn’t book a place so I messaged the owner of listing directly. He said there would be no problem if we booked his place. I messaged Airbnb and sent them proof of the listing persons messages and they still would not change it. These house are NOT Airbnb owned and this is NOT airbnbs money. Such a joke. They are hurting.

title: Profit over people.
text: This company very much neglects the human aspect of their business. Having zero protections for those who rent properties from hosts and allowing hosts to dictate credit or return policies is a joke. We had heard from friends that the service was in decline—we just didn’t expect it to be quite this drastic. Spend the extra money and book with a real business that still remembers that physical human beings keep the tourism industry alive.

title: Airbnb support completely failed us
text:
The place we booked was completely misleading. One thing after another would break with next to nothing done by the host.

I would like to preface this that Thailand is 90+ degrees and having a air conditioner is vital. When we showed up only one of the two barely worked and after a week it started leaking creating huge water damage all along the walls and on the floor. We had to use pots to catch the water. On top of that the seal on the toilet is rotted causing puddles of runoff water to puddle in the bathroom. And the washing machine is broken. It won’t drain either so there’s just a pool of murky washing machine water stuck in in there. We contacted the host MANY times and after they responding with ‘hi’ every once and a while they just decided to ghost us. After more looking around I found mold which probably explains why I’ve been feeling so sick this entire trip. 
Airbnb wants us to move places (on my and my roomies dime of course.) but 
my roommate and I can’t afford to apartment hop. Especially when the refund deal is so awful. Their final offer is 30% off the first day. and a refund on the cleaning fee. 

So basically we save what? 30$ dollars? 
Thanks Airbnb. You really saved the day! (Please note the sarcasm). 
On top of that they only want to refund the remaining days which would make sense if they would contact us quickly. Instead they take days to respond and than get annoyed when we need quick resolutions as both me and my roommate are sick from the growing mold.

Clearly the host was in the wrong and was purposely misleading in the listing. 
But also just as clearly Airbnb treats their customers extremely poorly.

title: Love it
text: The UI bug was fixed. No complains! Love it

title: discrimination
text: i feel like airbnb discriminates. I try using it and after verification and verification and without any detail on why it says they cancel it due to who i am associated with. i don’t know what that means but i have a clean record and i only associate myself with fellow veterans. So i don’t even understand what that means but i take that as a insult that they would even judge someone like that.

title: Almost perfect
text: Love the interface design. The best design in the industry. Just waiting for them to verify listing to weed out fake listings. It’s not that hard. They have the technology for it. I just don’t know why they don’t do it.

title: Question
text: I LOVE Air BnB’s but I wonder why there is usually no breakfast included in an Air Bed and Breakfast?

title: New version - no map
text: Map is not loading for background in any search area. No clue where the properties are located according to city/area proximity.

title: Forcing people to use your app on an iPhone and not the website is disgusting.
text: It’s an absolute disgrace forcing people to have to use your application rather than allowing them to access Airbnb via a website or browser. If I could leave less than one store I would.

title: Poor Policy
text: Pretty much a rip off company

title: piss poor
text: I have never made a rsv with airbnb  before today. But i put my payment down. And then 10 minutes later i get a message saying account closed. And all i would get was some operator passing on to a different dpt. Kept getting the same email back. Said i miss represented myself. All i did was put in the info they asked for and took the selfi it ask for. . But they were real quick to take the deposit out that will take 5 days to show up. But can’t give a detailed reason what is going on .

title: If you have felonies DONT ATTEMPT TO RENT !!!!
text:
While downloading the app no where did it say you couldn’t rent if you had previous convictions .
That is my past !!! They waited until I paid for 2 night beach rental took my money and took me out of the app due to my past convictions . !!! Now I’m trying to figure out how to get my money back !!!

title: Customer Service is Useless
text: We had a terrible experience at an Airbnb, but the worst part was that Airbnb did nothing about it. We were in a downstairs unit, and the owners of the upstairs unit left their dog alone by itself, barking for over two hours. There was a shared entryway with these owners, and we didn’t want to risk conflict with them by reporting them. However, after two hours, we contacted the host and told them what was going on and asked if we could have a refund so that we could find alternate accommodations. The host never acknowledged our request. We waited an hour, then booked an alternate place and left. We didn’t spend any nights in the place. We contacted Airbnb support for a refund, who was nice, saying that the host never acknowledged our message, and that he’s glad we went to a hotel. However, then he messaged us later saying that they can’t do anything about it because the host doesn’t want to refund us. By the way, the unit was cold, grimy, and didn’t look like the pictures. The hotel was only about a half mile away, was clean, had a pool and hot tub, and was cheaper than the Airbnb. I’m done with Airbnb after this experience. They did nothing to help with the situation, so I’m not sure why I would give them any more of my business.

title: Category Feature Ruins App
text:
I will switch to vbro since this feature makes you select a category like Trending/Beachfront/Cabin/Cottage.  I will return if this feature is expanded so you can select “no preference.”
It would also be nice if instead of the category Fun, you could specify what actually you were looking for like a pool or pool table and not have a bunch of listing show up with a community playground.  
Beach house is the only really useful category at the moment for people looking for a normal vacation or short term rental for travel.

title: Poor functionality and service  - multiple issues to fix
text:
App functionality for resolution of issues in terms of photo / video upload does not work. It removes your media and then disables functionality. 

All functionality for completion of payment requests does not work at all. When logged in for an current reservation a request was routed to my email prompting me to log in via browser through FB and requiring Meta secondary verification to complete. No record of this payment is visible in the app. 

For all of the fees paid to ensure airbnbs support I had to complain 5x about a false listing to get ANY response. It is still unresolved. Support wait times quoted are entirely fictitious.

title: Good and Bad
text:
A couple general things I’ve noticed: 

-There are lots of commercial rental properties that rent on ABnB. The app still describes all listings as “you’ll be staying in someone’s home….” Which is definitely not true. 

-The prices used to be good enough to book an Airbnb over a hotel 100% of the time. Now it’s more like 50/50.

-I’m finding that most listings charge a (usually significant) cleaning fee -AND- ask you to do the dishes, take out the trash, etc.

I still book through Air BnB periodically and the app experience itself is pretty trouble free, but the whole experience has become less pleasant over time.

title: I’m not changing it back until they respond
text:
Changing this from 4 stars to 1 star. Dear Airbnb, I don’t need you to remove my future guests without prior notice, especially at a time like this. Give me the superhost relief fund I’m qualified for. I’ve been a superhost for almost 5 years straight and made you thousands of dollars. Your customer service agents talked to me like I was an annoyance to them when I asked. I’ve been bleeding money every month for the last two months and for months to come. I can’t pay for mortgage in full. Is this how you treat your superhosts? Absolutely ridiculous.

Update: they’ve really outdone themselves with their crappy customer service. They raised service fees for both hosts and guests. They’ve lowered the quality of service on both ends. They’re really trying to run their business to the ground.

title: PEOPLE WITH COVID
text: Also why should I have to share space with someone who has COVID. The dude is walking around coughing all over 24.7 and the hosts are doing nothing.

title: Price changed right when I was going to book
text: Been using Airbnb since the beginning.  In spite of their heavy fees, I still used them. That won’t be happening anymore.   I had chosen a place and right when I went to finalize, the price changed per night.  From $119 to $149. I’ll be taking my business elsewhere.

title: Love the app but hosts and airbnb support has been brutal
text: Had a scenario where host was unresponsive for a longer time and we were not able to check in until 8 PM. Support staff repeatedly told us to cancel and after asking for compensation they started with $50 and gradually raised their compensation but were unable to do justice with how much we regretted our Valentine’s day trip
